definition:
A *$\sigma$-ring of sets* is a nonempty collection $\mathcal{S}$ of sets
such that

-   if $A \in \mathcal{S}$ and $B \in \mathcal{S}$ then
    $A-B \in \mathcal{S}$ and

-   if $A_i \in \mathcal{S}$ for $i=1,2 \ldots,$ then
    $\cup_{i=1}^{\infty} A_i \in \mathcal{S}$

A $\sigma$-ring is also closed under countable intersections since
$$\cap_{i=1}^{\infty} A_i = A - \cup_{i=1}^{\infty}(A-A_i)$$ where
$A = \cup_{i=1}^{\infty} A_i$.

$\sigma$-rings are used in measure theory.
